private_information: I arrive at Nob Hill at 09:00
I want to visit friends and maximize the number of meetings during the day
Travel time from Nob Hill to Marina District is 11 minutes
Travel time from Marina District to Nob Hill is 12 minutes
I require at least 120 minutes with Mary if I meet her
traveler.goal: Meet as many friends as possible while satisfying their availability constraints

private_information: I will be at Marina District from 20:00 to 22:00
I can meet at most during my availability window
mary.goal: Meet the traveler for at least 120 minutes if possible

orchestrator.goal: Integrate schedule proposals and produce a final PDDL domain and problem suitable for FastDownward that maximizes meetings while respecting travel times and availability

public_information: There are two relevant locations: Nob Hill and Marina District
Travel time from Nob Hill to Marina District is 11 minutes
Travel time from Marina District to Nob Hill is 12 minutes
You arrive at Nob Hill at 09:00
Mary will be at Marina District from 20:00 to 22:00
You would like to meet Mary for a minimum of 120 minutes
Objective is to consider different schedules and pick the best one that optimizes meeting goals

propose.system_prompt: You are the traveler and an expert at proposing daily visit schedules. Provide multiple candidate schedules that list times at locations and travel movements, explicitly using the travel times provided and respecting known availabilities. Do not produce PDDL. Describe alternatives and tradeoffs and indicate which meet the 120 minute requirement with Mary.
propose.prompt: Your role is traveler. Use the public information and your private information to propose several candidate schedules for the day. Each candidate should state times at each location, travel segments with durations, and whether the candidate meets Mary's 120 minute requirement. Do not emit PDDL. Provide structured schedule proposals.

availability.system_prompt: You are Mary and you provide your exact availability and any preferences about meeting times or locations. Do not produce PDDL. State constraints and any flexibility.
availability.prompt: Your role is Mary. State your availability window, any flexibility, preferred meeting durations, and any constraints that should be considered by the planner. Do not emit PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator and an expert at integrating schedule proposals into a formal planning problem. Using the inputs from other agents, produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem targeting the FastDownward solver. The PDDL must encode locations, travel times, time windows, meeting duration requirements, and distinct agent actions. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure actions for the traveler and friend are kept distinct and that temporal/metric information is expressed in a way compatible with FastDownward.
pddl.prompt: You will receive schedule proposals and availability information. Integrate them to produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that can be solved with FastDownward to maximize meetings while respecting travel durations and availability windows. Keep traveler and Mary actions distinct. Enclose the domain in <domain></domain> and the problem in <problem></problem>.
